intro: Jambosa vrieseana, commonly known as the Vriesea orchid, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect water. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with colorful bracts that can range from red to orange. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Jambosa vrieseana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
